head.supplied: ¶ [Baron Von Mueller asking what success had attended the planting out of the seeds sent by Government for Sand Hummocks reclamation]...

div.p: Minute book 5, pp. 335-6, Borough Council records, Port Fairy, Victoria.

Letter not found. M's letter was read at a Council meeting on 7 February 1877. For a printed copy of this report see Belfast gazette, 9 February 1877, p. 2.
[Baron Von Mueller asking what success had attended the planting out of the seeds sent by Government for Sand Hummocks reclamation]
Council 'Resolved that a letter be forwarded in reply stating actual result of experiments thanking the Baron for his past services ad accepting with pleasure any future donation of seeds'; letter not found. 'The Town Clerk stated that Mr. Cole, the [...]man, had sown some of the seed [...] Baron Mueller in his paddock [...] and took all kinds of care to [...] but without success. | Resolved that a letter be forwarded to Dr Mueller, conveying the thanks of [...] his kindness in forwarding the [...] received, and desiring a further [...] would be sown at the proper [...] carefully attended to.' (Belfast gazette, 9 February 1877, p. 3). 'Mr. Cole' not further identified . need to check another copy in LtL because film of this one cuts off some text.
